Platform.Title: Escherichia coli 5K oligo microarray
Platform.Description: Escherichia coli 5K oligo microarray produced by Digital Genomics, Inc. Seoul, Korea.

Sample.Title: PCK_glucose-minimal medium_early log phase

Channel.Characteristics: E. coli W3110 with glucose-minimal medium (IPTG induced) at early log phase (u=0.25)
Channel.Growth-Protocol: The medium for batch culture was consisted of 11.3 g M9 medium, 0.2 g MgSO4•7H2O, 0.1 g CaCl2, 1 mg thiamine, 10 g NaHCO3 and 9 g glucose, 50 mg ampicillin and 0.1 mmole IPTG per liter.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Transcriptome of cells was prepared using a RNA extraction kit (RNeasy mini kit;Qiagen, Hilden, Germany)
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 1. To 20-50g of total RNA (or 2g poly(A) RNA), add necessary control RNA mixture and 2l of oligo(dT) primer (0.5g/l ). Make the final volume up to 31L with RNase-free water. For human and mouse RNA samples, 20g of total RNA is sufficient for hybridization in ASP. For Drosophila RNA sample, 50 g of total RNA is needed for ASP. For less amount of RNA, hybridization should be performed mannually in a smaller volume of hybridization buffer. 2. Mix well and incubate at 70 C for 10 minutes. Chill on ice for 1 min. Spin briefly. 3. Add followings to the RNA solution: 5X First Strand buffer 10L 0.1 M DTT 5L Rnasin 1L 50X aminoallyl-dNTP mix 1L SuperScript II (200U/L) 2L 4. Mix and incubate at 42 °C for 1 hr. Add additional 1l of superscript II and incubate for another 1 hr. 5. To hydrolyze RNA, add 16.5l of 1 M NaOH and 16.5l of 0.5 M EDTA. Mix and incubate at 65 °C for 15 minutes. Add 16.5L of 1 M HCl to neutralize pH. 6. Clean-up the cDNA reaction with Microcon YM-30 (Cat No. 42409) 7. Dry sample in a speed vac. Add D.W. and 1M sodium carbonate buffer to resuspend cDNA pellet in 9.0ul of 0.1M sodium carbonate buffer 8. Add 2.0L of the appropriate NHS-ester Cy dye 9. Incubate the reaction for 1 hour in the dark at room temperature. 10. Clean up the coupling reaction with QIAquick PCR purification kit. Repeat the elution step twice with 30L elution buffer to get 60L of elution volumn. 11. Calculate the pmole nucleotide, pmole Cy3, Cy5, and nucleotide/dye ratio. (Determine O.D. at 260nm, 550nm, 650nm, and 700nm.) 12. Dry the Cy3 and Cy5 sample in a speed vac. and proceed to hybridization step.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: 1. Dissolve the dried labeled sample in a reasonable volume of hybridization buffer depending on the area to be covered. (Typically, 22X22mm cover-slip requires 25 ㎕ of hybridization buffer. 22X60mm cover-slip requires 60 ㎕). 2. Heat the labeled sample preparation for 5min at 95℃. 3. Spin down for 30 sec. Do not put on ice!!! 4. Place slide in the hybridization chamber. Put 20㎕ of 3XSSC to the chamber at both ends of the slide. 5. Pipette the labeled target onto the slide surface. 6. Carefully place the cover-slip on top of the slide. Try to reduce the formation of air bubbles. 7. Seal the hybridization chamber and incubate in 42℃. Water-bath or hybridization oven for more than 16 hr.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: DNA chips were scanned using an Axon GenePix 4000B Scanner(Axon Instruments, Union City, CA) with the laser set to 532 and 635 nm, the photomultiplier tube (PMT) voltage to 600 and the scan resolution to 10 µm.
Sample.Data-Processing: Scanned images were analyzed with GenePix Pro 3.0 software (Axon Instruments, Union City, CA) to obtain gene expression ratios.

Sample.Title: PPC_LB-GlC medium_D=0.1 h-1

Channel.Source: E. coli W3110 (KCTC 2223) at LB-GlC medium, D=0.1 h-1
Channel.Characteristics: E. coli W3110 grown at LB-glucose medium (IPTG induction) in chemostat (D=0.1 h-1)

Do not put on ice!!! 4. Place slide in the hybridization chamber. Put 20㎕ of 3XSSC to the chamber at both ends of the slide. 5. Pipette the labeled target onto the slide surface. 6. Carefully place the cover-slip on top of the slide. Try to reduce the formation of air bubbles. 7. Seal the hybridization chamber and incubate in 42℃. Water-bath or hybridization oven for more than 16 hr.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: DNA chips were scanned using an Axon GenePix 4000B Scanner(Axon Instruments, Union City, CA) with the laser set to 532 and 635 nm, the photomultiplier tube (PMT) voltage to 600 and the scan resolution to 10 µm.
Sample.Data-Processing: Scanned images were analyzed with GenePix Pro 3.0 software (Axon Instruments, Union City, CA) to obtain gene expression ratios. Logged gene expression ratios were normalized by LOWESS regression (Yang et al., 2002) using the GeneSpring GX 7.3 software (Agilent Technologies).

Series.Title: Effect pck or ppc expression on intracellular ATP
Series.Summary: Up-regulation of motility genes and biosynthesis genes were found in the pck expressing high ATP cell by transcriptome analysis while catabolism genes were down-regulated. Keywords: response depends on intracellular ATP concentration derived by pck or ppc overexpression
Series.Overall-Design: 1. pck or ppc overexpressing E. coli at early log phase using glucose-minimal medium 2. pck or ppc overexpressing E. coli at chemostat culture (D=0.1 h-1)using LB-glucose medium
